revised_title: Improving the Differential Barometer for Measuring Air Pressure
tldr: The author, William Hyde Wollaston, describes an improved differential barometer that can measure small differences in barometric pressure with greater accuracy. The instrument uses a compact glass tube with two legs connected to separate cisterns filled with water and oil. By adjusting the oil-water mixture, the instrument can detect even the slightest changes in air pressure, making it useful for measuring wind forces and understanding how air moves through spaces.
